result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript - 3/24/16 Plea and Sentencing Hearing, Judge Wambach presiding.
Transcript of March 24, 2016 - Excerpt only or Plea and Sentencing Hearing

[Court Reporter Linda Coleman]
Cases 15CF249, 15CF295,15CM211,15CM218,15CM245,15CM247,15CM249 and 16CM25 called together at 3:00pm
Defendant Donald H. Zache in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 
ADA Teuber motions to amend the Information in 15CF295; gives basis
--Atty. De La Rosa verifies receipt
--the Court grants motion to Amend
--ADA Teuber submits Amended Information

--pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CM211; the Court finds Mr. Zache is a repeater as to these offenses 
--plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on 15CM218
--plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on 15CM245, with weapons enhancer stricken
--plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #2 of 15CF249
--plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on 15CF295 as Amended; the Court finds that Mr. Zache is a repeater 
--plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on 16CM25 

factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #1 in 15CF249, and cases 15CM247 and 15CM249

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber
--ADA Teuber submits victim impact statements

Upon inquiry of the Court, Atty. De La Rosa indicates that the amount of restitution is stipulated
The Court finds that the amounts of restitution are supported factually; further the Court finds that the Defendant has the ability to pay the restitution amounts

Sentencing arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa

On Case 15CM211, Count #1: the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for a term of 2 years, with conditions:
--to pay statutory court costs
--no direct or indirect contact with Eleany M. Castro (dob 11/17/1997)
--the prohibits contact with Eleany Castro by any electronic means; phone, Facebook, snapchat, twitter, linkedin
--no presence on Kastin Road in the Town of Lake Mills
--not to engage in any intimate relationships with females
--to serve 10 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work release/ Huber, this sentence is to be served at the conclusion of the sentence in 16CM25

The Court directs the Court reporter to provide the Court with an Official Transcript of the conditions of probation relating to the no contact with Eleany Castro, as to ease the imposition of the condition

As to all other counts the Court follows the agreement of the parties: 
On Case 15CM211, Count #2: The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail,with Huber/work release privileges, this sentence is to being FORTHWITH


On Case 15CM218:The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail,with Huber/work release privileges, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM211, Count #2


On Case 15CM245:The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail,with Huber/work release privileges, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM218


On Case 15CF249:The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 75 days in Jefferson County Jail,with Huber/work release privileges, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM245


On Case 15CF295:The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail,with Huber/work release privileges, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CF249
--The Court orders a civil judgment be entered against Mr. Zache in the amount of $324.48 in favor of Donna Hafenstein


On Case 16CM25:The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail,with Huber/work release privileges, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CF295
--The Court orders a civil judgment be entered against Mr. Zache in the amount of $300 in favor of Bradley Barnes

Days Credit:
--Case 15CM211, Count #2 = 3 days
--Case 15CM218= 41 days
--Case 15CF249= 54 days 
--All other cases= 0 days

All court costs are to be coverted to civil judgment
The Court authorizes transfer of jail sentences to Dodge County, so long as it served as would be in Jefferson County, that is without home detention, electronic monitoring, or any passive detention and so long as it is at no additonal cost to Jefferson County. 

recess: 4:18pm

Cases 15CF249, 15CF295,15CM211, 15CM218,15CM245, 15CM247,15CM249,16CM25 and 15CF192 called together at 2:08pm [mo]
Defendant Donald H. Zache in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CF192 [FSSC scheduled]
ADA Teuber motions to dismiss case 15CF192; gives basis
The Court grants the State's Motion to Dismiss case 15CF192

As to Case 16CM25, Initial Appearance occurs:

Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The State does not request a bond
The Court does not require a bond in case 16CM25
recess: 2:19pm

As to ALL Cases: Plea and Sentencing on 3/24/16 at 2:45pm((allow 1 1/2hour))

Cases 15CF192,15CF249,15CF295,15CM211,15CM218,15CM245,15CM247,and 15CM249 called together at 11:33am [mo]
Defendant Donald H. Zache in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. De La Rosa gives case update
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court schedules case 15CF192 for FSSC and Jury Trial; the other cases will follow as STC on the date of the FSSC.
The Court distributes its scheduling order
recess: 11:44am

NEXT: (1)As to Case 15CF192: FSSC/As to All other Cases: STC on 2/15/16 at 2:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 2/18/16 at 8:30am

Case 15CF295 called at 9:07am [mo]
Defendant Donald H. Zache in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CF295(Preliminary Hearing occurs):  

Deputy Peter Betanski -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA 
Hall
--cross examination by Attorney 
De La Rosa 


Detective Vaughn Johnson- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa 

Arguments given by Counsel
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Zache committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no demand for speedy trial 

The Court now calls Cases 15CF192, 15CF249,15CM211,15CM218,15CM245,15CM247, 15CM249 (9:42am)
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. De La Rosa requests that all cases be scheduled for PTC and STC
--no objection from ADA Hall
recess: 9:45am

NEXT: On all cases: (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/2/15 at 9:00am (2) Status Conference on 1/5/16 at 10:00am

Cases 15CF192, 15CM211, 15CM218,15CM245,15CM247 AND 15CM249 called together at 8:52am [mo]
Defendant Donald H. Zache in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that a reolution has not been met, although discussions have been made, requests an additional PTC and STC out 45 days.
--ADA Hall requests that the PTC be out 30 days.

ADA Hall indicates that Mr. Zache has a case scheduled for Initial Appearance in Branch 3, case 15CF295.
recess: 9:06--reconvene:9:10am [to allow Court and Counsel to obtain and review the Criminal Complaint in case 15CF295]

The Court now calls additionally calls 15CF295 and 15CF249; the appearances remain the same

As to Case 15CF295(Initial Appearance occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.


Bond Arguments given by Counsel
The Court requires a $20,000   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at the Riverbend Campground

The Court directs the Clerk to schedule case 15CF295 for Preliminary Hearing; all other cases to be scheduled for STC on same date and time.

The Court directs the Clerk to remove from the Court's calendar the Initial Appearacne in case 15CF295 and the STC in case 15CF249
recess: 9:21am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing in Case 15CF295 on 10/26/15 at 9:00am//Cases 15CF192, 15CM211, 15CM218,15CM245,15CM247, 15CM249 and 15CF249 to be scheduled for STC on the same date and time.
